problem_text: Suppose that G is a finite group, and A1, A2, A3 are subsets of G such that the multiplication map A1 × A2 × A3 → G is bijective. Must the subgroup ⟨A2⟩ generated by A2 have order divisible by the cardinality |A2|? This is Question 8 in (G. M. Bergman, J. Iranian Math. Soc., 1 (2020), 157–161). It is known (ibid.) that the corresponding statement is true for the subgroups ⟨A1⟩ and ⟨A3⟩. Moreover, |A2| will at least divide the order of the least subgroup containing A2 and closed under conjugation by members of A1, and similarly of the least subgroup containing A2 and closed under conjugation by members of A3. G. M. Bergman
